VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The LP pricing formula used in the burnAsset function of LimboDAO is vulnerable to flashloan manipulation.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Use a fair pricing formula for the LP tokens, for example, the one proposed by Alpha Finance

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Consistently check account balance before and after transfers for Fee-On-Transfer discrepancies.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Check the balance before and after the transfer to take into account the Fees-On-Transfer.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The system can get to a stuck state if a bad proposal (proposal that can't be executed) is accepted.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Replace proposal.execute() with a call that returns a success boolean so that the DAO doesn't get stuck on broken proposals

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The LimboDAO.sol contract's governance decision logic can be manipulated to flip decisions without extending the vote duration, allowing a user to change the vote without triggering the logic to extend the vote duration.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Require the square of the vote to not equal the currentFate and revert if not

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The function proxy in RebaseProxy.sol is vulnerable to wrong minting amount.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Implement balanceBefore and balanceAfter calculation with the diff being wrapped

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: If a user has a pending reward and he calls the stake function with amount = 0, he won't be able to get his reward.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Remove the if statement that checks if the staked amount is greater than 0

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Most of the proposal contracts have a parameterize function for setting the proposal parameters, and these functions are protected only by the notCurrent modifier.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Only allow the creator of the proposal to modify the parameters

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Tolerance is not enforced during a flash governance decision.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Rewrite the _governanceApproved function and the governanceApproved modifier

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Incorrect unlockTime can DOS withdrawGovernanceAsset.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Change the calculation of unlockTime

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Logic error in burnFlashGovernanceAsset can cause locked assets to be stolen.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Change line 134 to delete pendingFlashDecision[targetContract][user] instead of setting the pendingFlashDecision to the default

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Burning a User's Tokens for a Flash Proposal will not Deduct Their Balance.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Delete the user's data or only update pendingFlashDecision[targetContract][user].amount to subtract the amount sent as a function parameter

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The transferAndCall function in ERC677 transfers the value amount of tokens twice instead of once, leading to a double transfer vulnerability.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Remove the redundant transfer function call in the transferAndCall function

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The function withdrawGovernanceAsset in FlashGovernanceArbiter.sol is vulnerable to reentrancy.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Implement the check-effects-interactions pattern or delete the pendingFlashDecision before making the external call

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Users who have not called withdrawGovernanceAsset() after they have locked their tokens from a previous proposal will lose their tokens if assertGovernanceApproved() is called again with the same target and sender.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Update the initial if statement to ensure the pendingFlashDecision for that target and sender is empty

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Lack of access control on the assertGovernanceApproved function of FlashGovernanceArbiter allows anyone to lock other users' funds in the contract.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Only allow certain addresses to call the assertGovernanceApproved function on FlashGovernanceArbiter

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: You can grief migrations by sending SCX to the UniswapHelper.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Do = instead of == so sending tokens can't grief this.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Calling generateFLNQuote twice in every block prevents any migration.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Force the caller to pay EYE if the interval is below the min required. The EYE is then burnt.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Trades can happen at a manipulated price and end up receiving fewer Flan to be bought than current market price dictates.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add the minimum accepted price as a function argument so a user can limit the effective slippage, and check that actually received amount is above this accepted minimum

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: All the scxMinted is at risk of being burnt.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Insert a require statement on line 222.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: flan can't be transferred unless the flan contract has flan balance greater than the amount we want to transfer.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: It should check address(msg.sender)'s balance instead of address(this)'s balance.

VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Flash loan price manipulation can occur in the purchasePyroFlan() function due to the use of a single data point of LP balances to calculate the growth variable, which can be manipulated with flash loans.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Use a TWAP instead of the pool price at a single point in time to increase the cost of performing a flashloan sandwich attack
